basics.name: Jacob Swartz
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: In-depth understanding of the core fundamentals of software development: concept and design, programming, debugging, implementation, and management. Extensive experience deploying and managing Linux server environments. Easily self-motivated – capable of working independently as well as being a strong team player. Highly proficient using the LAMP stack with a passion to improve and expand skillsets.

highlights: Develop, maintain, and manage sites and custom features for clients
Install and configure versioning, web, and mailservers
Utilize APIs to quickly import product metadata, saving time for new additions
Generate tailored reports from cart platforms for e-commerce clients

work.summary: Innovative design solutions for print, web, multimedia, apparel & promotional products.
highlights: Implemented and configured hardware for in-house web, storage, and FTP servers
Set up tools for project tracking, task management, and time logging
Created website boilerplates for various categories of clients

work.summary: Ask.com (originally known as Ask Jeeves) is a question answering-focused e-business and web search engine founded in 1996 by Garrett Gruener and David Warthen in Berkeley, California.
highlights: Worked on an agile development team responsible for 3+ million unique articles and Q&A pairs
Repaired sites affected by Google’s search algorithm “Panda”, resuming AdSense revenue
Led team to use more efficient processes in order to more rapidly create, edit, and share mockups and one-offs
Migrated top revenue earning sites to dotCMS under strict deadlines

work.summary: FontShop International is an international manufacturer of digital typefaces, based in Berlin. It is one of the largest digital type foundries.
highlights: Created a dynamic, responsive eCommerce experience using HTML5, CSS3 + Sass, and JavaScript
Optimized pages to decrease load time and increase SEO ranking
Developed font rendering tool for sampling over 100,000 typefaces
Implemented sitewide templating and internationalization supporting 4 languages
Migrated from cumbersome images and Flash hacks to webfonts with TypeKit
Worked with payment processing systems: CyberSource, Ogone
Maintained WordPress blog extended with custom features
Helped organize and run TYPO – one of Europe’s most successful design conferences – for its U.S. premiere at Yerba Buena Center for the Art

work.summary: Fish Flirt marketing was a web design and development shop, building websites and services for in-house and contract clients.
highlights: Developed and maintained websites for clients using the LAMP stack. W3C compliant HTML4, CSS2, and JavaScript
Installed, configured, and managed SVN, web, and mail servers

references.name: Chris Hamamoto
references.reference: Jacob was a pleasure to work with, very talented, prompt, and personable. I feel the projects we worked on together were truly collaborative, resulting in outcomes that took advantage of both our expertise.

references.name: Stephen Coles
references.reference: Smart guy. Learns and works fast. We got a lot of FontShop.com stuff done together.

references.name: Luke Sedmak
references.reference: Jacob is a quick learner with unlimited potential. His ambition allows him to gain a deep understanding of new concepts and execute them in a real-world environment.
